title: Quiz 3: Roles & Responsibilities
description: Examines the specific duties and functions of key PHC implementers, including the Government, NGOs, Community Committees, and Households.

questions.question: Which body is chaired by the District Commissioner and coordinates all development work in the district?
questions.explanation: The District Development Committee (DDC) is the supreme development body in the district, chaired by the DC.
questions.hint: It covers ALL development, not just health.

questions.question: Which of the following are responsibilities of the **Village Health Development Committee**? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Identify health problems in the community
Select and supervise Community Health Workers

questions.explanation: Village committees focus on local identification, supervision of CHWs, and local projects. They do not make national laws or perform surgery.
questions.hint: Focus on grassroots management and local initiatives.

questions.question: Match the organization/level with its primary responsibility:

pairs.right: Technical support and supervision of districts
Planning and implementation of district services

questions.hint: Headquarters sets the rules; Districts do the work.

questions.question: The 'PHC Core Team' at the district level is responsible for the day-to-day management of PHC development activities.
questions.explanation: The DHMT delegates day-to-day management to the PHC Core Team.
questions.hint: The DHMT handles overall planning, but the Core Team handles daily ops.

questions.question: Community ___BLANK___ is defined as the process by which a community mobilizes resources and shares in decision-making.
questions.explanation: Community Participation is the key concept defined as mobilizing resources and sharing decision-making.
questions.hint: It means taking part in something.

questions.question: Order the flow of PHC awareness creation from the top/administrative level down to the village:
questions.explanation: Information flows from District -> Division -> Location -> Village/Grassroots.

questions.question: Which NGO is specifically mentioned in the study material as being involved in CBHC projects?

richContent.content: Hint: This organization is famous for its 'Flying Doctors' service in East Africa.

questions.explanation: AMREF is explicitly listed as an NGO actively involved in CBHC schemes in Kenya.

questions.question: What does the abbreviation 'DHMT' stand for?
questions.explanation: DHMT stands for District Health Management Team.
questions.hint: The team that manages health at the district level.

questions.question: Identify the responsibilities of the **National Level** government from the list below. (Select all that apply)

options.text: Review and evaluate PHC activities nationally

questions.explanation: The National Level handles high-level review, international liaison, and support. It does not directly manage small village facilities.

questions.question: Read the scenario below. Which principle of 'Community Involvement' is being demonstrated?

richContent.content: Scenario: The village of Kijiji uses a 'Self Diagnosis' approach to identify that dirty water is their biggest health threat. They then decide to contribute money and labor to build a protected well without waiting for government instructions.

questions.explanation: The community identifying their own problems and solving them demonstrates self-reliance and ownership, a key goal of community involvement.
